fr.dauphine.javaavance.phineloops.model

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.dauphine.javaavance.phineloops.model.Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    Represent a grid. ie : a level of the phineloops game.
    See Also:
    Grid

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int height
      The height of the grid
      private Piece[][] pieces
      The pieces composing the grid, double dimension array first index is abscissa and second index ordinate

      The list of the fixed pieces of the grid
      private int width
      The width of the grid

      • getPieceNeighbours

        public Piece[] getPieceNeighbours(Piece p)
        Retrieves neighbours (adjacent pieces) for a piece
        Parameters:
        p - the piece for which we want to know its neighbours
        Returns:
        an array of Piece with index : 0 -> north, 1 -> east, 2 -> south, 3 -> west

      • getAllNeighbours

        public java.util.HashMap<Piece,Piece[]> getAllNeighbours()
        Retrieves the neighbours for each piece of the grid
        Returns:
        a map with each key is a piece and corresponding value is its neighbours

      • getPossiblePieces

        public java.util.Set<Piece> getPossiblePieces(int x,
                                              int y)
        Method that indicates the possible pieces for a case of the grid
        Parameters:
        int - x abscissa
        int - y ordinate
        Returns:
        a set of possible pieces

      • getAllowedValues

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getAllowedValues(int x,
                                                         int y)
        Get piece numbers, for a position, which are acceptable for making a solvable grid. This method does not take care of other pieces already put on the grid.
        Parameters:
        x - abscissa
        y - ordinate
        Returns:
        Set of piece numbers for a piece position on the grid

      • isAllowedOrientation

        public boolean isAllowedOrientation(Piece p,
                                    java.util.List<Piece> s)
        If orientation of given piece is ok with pieces already tested and with its position on the grid (corner, edge...)
        Parameters:
        p - a piece to test its orientation
        s - pieces already visited by the solver
        Returns:
        true if the piece can stay in this orientation or false if it can't
        See Also:
        Piece

                       int c)
        Color a piece of the grid
        Parameters:
        Piece - p the piece to color
        int - c the color
        See Also:
